required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Observe the Impacts of Anti-Tumor Necrosis Factor (TNF) Effectiveness on Improvement in Work Place and Household Productivity for Patients With Psoriatic Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: To Observe the Impacts of Anti-TNF's Effectiveness on Improvement in Work Place and Household Productivity for Patients With Psoriatic Arthritis

brief_summary.textblock: This post marketing observational study (PMOS) is designed to provide the initial data on work impairment of Psoriatic Arthritis (PsA) patients in Turkey, as well as changes in work impairment, life quality and clinical response during treatment with anti-TNF agents.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the impact of long term treatment of psoriatic arthritis with anti-TNFs on Absenteeism
primary_outcome.description: To collect the number of missed working days and the number of working days

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the impact of long term treatment of psoriatic arthritis with anti-TNFs on Presenteeism
primary_outcome.description: To collect the number of working days and the total number of working days

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the impact of long term treatment of psoriatic arthritis with anti-TNFs on work productivity
Evaluation of the impact of long term treatment of psoriatic arthritis with anti-TNFs on total daily activity impairment
primary_outcome.description: To collect total daily activity impairment by Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI) questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: To collect Self-reported functional status using Health Assessed Questionnaire (HAQ) questionnaire
Evaluation of the Anti-TNF treatment effectiveness based percentage of patients achieving American College Rheumatology (ACR) 20/ACR50
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effectiveness of Anti-TNF treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the Anti-TNF treatment effectiveness based percentage of patients achieving ACR 70
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effectiveness of Anti-TNF treatment
To evaluate the effectiveness of Anti-TNF treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Maastricht Ankylosing Spondylitis Enthesitis Score
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effectiveness of Anti-TNF treatment
To evaluate the effectiveness of Anti-TNF treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of swollen and/or tender joints
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effectiveness of Anti-TNF treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in levels of rheumatoid factor
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the effectiveness of Anti-TNF treatment
To evaluate the effectiveness of Anti-TNF treatment
To evaluate the effectiveness of Anti-TNF treatment
To collect physician's and patient's global assessment of disease activity and disease related pain and fatigue to evaluate the effectiveness of Anti-TNF treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: To report serious adverse events (SAE) occurring during treatment with anti-TNF agents

arm_group.arm_group_label: Psoriatic Arthritis patients treated with Anti-TNF
arm_group.description: Psoriatic Arthritis patients treated with Anti-TNF

study_pop.textblock: Patients from both genders will be included to this non-interventional epidemiological study from selected university or state hospital or Ministry of Health of Turkey training and research hospitals in Turkey.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: - Actively working, either full-time or part-time
- Previous confirmed diagnosis of PsA by a rheumatologist
- Patients for whom the physician has initiated PsA treatment with an Anti-TNF in accordance with Turkish Ministry of Health regulations and reimbursement criteria
- Able to provide authorization to use and disclose their health related information Exclusion Criteria: - Patients with a history of an allergic reaction or significant sensitivity to anti-TNF agents
- Patients with possible follow-up problems during the planned study period or patients who may not be compliant to treatment as evaluated by the investigator/treating physician
- Patients participating in any clinical trial of an experimental drug 30 days prior to the first visit
